article:
We live in a forest in Zambia . There aren't any neighbor _ nearby. And this community school is about an hour's drive from our home. It serves 169 students from Grade 1 to Grade 7. There are four teachers in the school. They are volunteers and they teach students _ getting any money. But sometimes students will give _ teachers some chicken and corn. There are over 70 languages in Zambia. English is the most popular and _ of the students can speak English.
There is no running water in the school and the water pump  is broken. Teachers and students can't _ it for two months. So they have to _ their water from a nearby river. During school holidays, it always rains _ and the grass grows taller and taller. When school opens again, students will _ the grass and the school ground.
Most children in Zambia go to the community schools _ other schools are too far for them to go. They like their schools and they love their teachers.
